resources.string: Align QR Code within frame to scan

Serial Number: %s 
 Firmware Version：%s
 SE Firmware Version: %s
 System Version：%s
Please go to Menu - Add / Hide Assets to add assets you need
"The recovery phrase is used to restore your wallet. Use a Keystone Tablet to record your 24 recovery phrase words and store them securely."
Do not share your recovery phrase with anyone or take a picture of it. If it is lost or stolen, all assets are irretrievable.
Here is your %s public key （safe to share）
This address is only for %s, other digital assets sent to the above address will be lost.

Please visit: <font color="#00cdc3">https://keyst.one/fw<font/> to check for firmware updates. If you are not using the latest firmware, download it from the official Keystone website and save it on a microSD card (FAT32 format). Transfer the file to your device as shown in the image below. (MicroSD card not included with purchase.)
*Please check your lock screen after confirm the import
1. Click on <font color="#00cdc3">"Scan QR Code"<font/> button below and scan the QR code displayed on the website
2. Your Keystone would then display a code. Please enter that into the official website to verify the authenticity of your device
3. Click <font color="#00cdc3">"Verify"<font/> button on the website to see your result
If the authentication fails, please do not use this device as it may have been compromised!
Upgrading your firmware to the latest version to benefit from new features is highly recommended.
A microSD card in FAT32 format with a maximum memory capacity of 512GB is required
A minimum of 70% battery charge is required

To download the latest firmware, please visit:
https://keyst.one/start/3

The new Firmware package was not detected.Please check whether your microSD card has been formatted to FAT32, has no more than 512GB of memory, and if the \'update.zip\' file has been properly copied onto the card.
I\'ve read and agreed to the <font color="#00cdc3"><u>\"Terms of Service\"</u><font/>, and <font color="#00cdc3"><u>\"Privacy Policy\"</u><font/>
1. Touch <font color="#00cdc3">\"Create Wallet\"<font/> to generate a new Wallet
2. Touch <font color="#00cdc3">\"Import Wallet\"<font/> to import an existing HD wallet
Please enter your %d-word recovery phrase in the table below.
Must include upper and lower case letters and numbers.

Important Information:
1. The recovery phrase is the only way retrieve your assets. Please use record your recovery phrase carefully and store in a safe location.

2. Do not take photos of your recovery phrase or store on a device connected to the Internet. Do not share the recovery phrase with others.

3. Visit https://keyst.one/kt to purchase a Keystone Tablet to store your recovery phrase with a higher degree of security.
Please enter your %d-word recovery phrase in the table below.
Scan <font color="#00cdc3">QR Code<font/> with Keystone Mobile
recovery phrase incorrect, please try again.
Pattern does not match, please draw again.
Incorrect password, you have %d attempts remaining.
Too many incorrect attempts, \n try password unlock.
All data will be erased. This cannot be undone.
Passphrases cannot exceed 128 characters. Can consist of upper and lower case letters, digits, symbols, spaces. Case Sensitive.

Important Information:\n1. When a Hidden Wallet is created, its Passphrase cannot be changed. If the Passphrase is lost or forgotten, the Hidden Wallet and all its assets will be irretrievable. Record and store the Passphrase securely before creating a Hidden Wallet \n2. Keep the Passphrase field blank to enter the default Wallet
Confirm to switch from current Wallet to new Wallet. You may return to any Wallet by entering its correct Passphrase. Note that the Passphrase for the default HD wallet is blank
Incorrect password, you have %d chances left.
Please enter your %d-word recovery phrase in the table below.
Confirm to delete White List Address:%s？
To protect your assets, all information has been erased from your Keystone. Please stop using this device and contact Customer Service immediately.\n Status Code:%s
Recovery phrase is incorrect, please try again.
Can only have up to 5 passphrase

Keystone is an air-gapped hardware wallet that uses completely transparent QR code data transmissions so you can verify what goes in and out of it. Our Secure Element performs true random number generation (TRNG) to ensure your private keys come from real, physical sources of entropy. All transaction signing occurs entirely within the Secure Element, which has state of the art defenses to protect you in the event that an attacker has physical access to your device.
Addresses may not be deleted once created. Please choose a name you will be able to recognize.
This device is no longer safe to use!
Slide to adjust the screen brightness
Scan QR code with Watch-only Wallet to get signature
Creating Wallet, please keep screen on.
Someone has attempted to hack your device!

Your device has been attacked and may have been compromised. By continuing to use this device, you are risking the disclosure of sensitive information and loss of your assets. We strongly recommend you erase all personal information on the device and contact Customer Service immediately.
Once a Wallet is created, the recovery phrase will not be displayed again!
Users only can send assets to the addresses stored on the white list. While the white list is empty, all transactions are prohibited.

1. If you have generated an address from your Pub Key, you can send and receive funds on Keystone mobile, and your account information will be automatically synchronized when you sign in with this device.\n2. If you haven’t generated an address, you can invite a friend with %s to scan this Pub Key and generate an address.
Anyone with your recovery phrase has full access to your cryptocurrency. Please make sure there are no onlookers or cameras when you record your recovery phrase.
Must contain at least 10 characters and include upper and lower case letters and digits. Symbols are allowed. Case sensitive.
Please open the following link using a PC: <font color="#00cdc3">https://keyst.one/start</font>
This will help guide setting up your Keystone hardware wallet.

You can create Passphrase(Hidden Wallet) or reset your password in Settings. \n Read the enclosed Quick Guide or visit our website to learn more:
https://keyst.one
Only install firmware upgrades downloaded from the official Keystone website.

The recovery phrase is the only way to retrieve your assets and password. If it is lost, your assets are irretrievable and the device may be locked! (The recovery phrase will not be displayed again after initialization of the device.)
Please input the verification code into the official website\'s Web Authentication page to have your device authenticated.
Device power level needs to be above %s to ensure the upgrade is successful. Current battery level is %s, please replace or charge the battery.
A new version %s is available for update. Compare the following sha256 with the sha256 of your download package on the official website, ensure that they are consistent, then click "Update Now"
This QR code is not supported.
Invalid QR Code. Please follow the instruction to scan the correct QR Code to complete authentication.
Please tap the QR code if you have difficulty scanning.
Place your finger on the fingerprint sensing area and remove it when you feel a vibration. Repeat until enrolling process is fully complete.
Place your finger on the fingerprint sensing area and press slightly.
Fingerprint can be used to sign transactions or unlock device.
Mobile app version does not match. Please update firmware and mobile app to the latest.
Wrong Password. This device will be wiped.
No Result\nPlease input the keywords of Signature
No Result\nPlease input address or the keywords of name
Pattern password is used to unlock the wallet
You can also go to [Menu > Settings > Version] and touch "Update Now" later.
All data will be erased. Please confirm whether to continue

1. Open Electrum and create a new wallet. 
2. Choose "Standard wallet". 
3. Choose "Use a master key". 
4. Touch "Show Master Public Key" below then click the camera icon in the "Create keystore from a master key" window in Electrum to scan the QR code that displays on Keystone. 
5. Set a password. 
6. Enter the watch-only wallet.
How to create a watch-only wallet in Electrum:
Please make sure you have inserted a FAT32 format microSD card
Please make sure the file you wish to sign was successfully saved to your microSD card.

In Electrum, go to Tools > Load Transaction > From QR Code\n\nDifficulty scanning? You can export the signed transaction data as a file using a microSD card and broadcast the transaction from a file with Electrum.

1. Open Electrumand and create a new wallet.
2. Choose "Standard wallet".
3. Choose "Use a master key". 
4. Click the camera icon in the "Create keystore from a master key" window in Electrum to scan the QR code that displays on Keystone.

Difficulty scanning? You can also export the master public key file using a microSD card.
Unable to read file, please try importing again.
In Electrum, go to Tools > Load Transaction > From File to open the file.
Please make sure you have inserted a FAT32 format microSD card.
Open when inputting your master public key on Electrum.
Scan the QR code with Electrum to broadcast
Scan master public key using Electrum
How to broadcast with Electrum:\nIn Electrum, go to Tools > Load Transaction > From File. Open the file, and click "Broadcast".

Difficulty scanning?Tap the QR code to enlarge
or touch here to export via microSD.
Difficulty scanning? You can import pending transactions from Electrum using a microSD card (Menu > MicroSD Card).
Transaction not recognized. Your Keystone has not been successfully paired with the watch-only wallet.
You have rolled %d times. We recommend you roll 99 times for 256-bit
You have rolled %d times. You need at least 50 rolls to generate a recovery phrase.

How to use dice to generate keys:

1. Roll the dice at least 50 times. Roll 99 times to obtain 256-bit entropy (recommended). There is no limit to the number of rolls you can use.
2. We recommend you use casino dice to increase the entropy of each dice throw.
To prevent peeping, track will be hidden when unlocked
Detect that the transaction is risky and cannot be signed. You can go to: https://keyst.one/fee-attack for details, or contact us: support@keyst.one
You have signed the transaction, can broadcast the transaction directly
*Keystone will never ask for your Recovery Phrase under any circumstances, please be sure to keep your Recovery Phrase and don’t disclose them to anyone
The entered recovery phrase does not match the one in the Keystone. Do not reset the device until a valid backup was verified.
You have entered an invalid recovery phrase, please try again.
The entered recovery phrase matched the one in the Keystone.

You have successfully upgraded to the latest version. To protect your assets, the Wallet automatically resets to the default wallet every time the device is restarted. (Also when it upgrades, shuts down or is restarted.)
Entering the default wallet, please keep screen on.
You need to enter the recovery phrase of this wallet when adding %s.For details, please visit: https://keyst.one/%s
The entered recovery phrase does not match the one in the Keystone. Please try again.

1. You have built %1$d/%2$d Shamir Backup. It\'s a Shamir Backup with %3$d shares and you need %4$d shares at least to recovery your wallet.

2. Next you will need to confirm each share. If all the shares are kept by a different person, please confirm that each confirmation is performed by the specific person.

3. Please don\'t take photos of the shares, or store it online. Don\'t share it to anyone else or you risk losing your funds.
Please confirm you are the custodian of the share #%d
Please enter the recovery phrase for <font color="#00cdc3">share #%d<font/> in the form below
The recovery phrase of this share was verified successfully, now proceed to the next share. Touch confirm and hand over to the second share custodian who keeps share number #%d.
The first share enter successfully, %d more shares needed to enter.
Share already entered, please enter a different share.
You have entered a share from another Shamir Backup.
The confirmed share will be lost after cancelling. Are you sure you want to cancel?
You have entered Super Shamir (two-level configuration of Shamir Backup), Keystone doesn’t support it currently.
The confirmed share will be lost after cancelling. Are you sure you want to cancel?
Check the Wallet with Single Backup
Check the Wallet with Shamir Backup
Import a Wallet with Single Backup
Import a Wallet with Shamir Backup
Create a Wallet with Shamir Backup
Create a Wallet with Single Backup
Please restart or contact us at support@keyst.one\n Status Code:%s
Erase all Information and Power off
It is recommended that you wipe the device and then reset it.Repeated retries failed, you can contact us：support@keyst.one\n Status Code:%s

string-array.name: watch_wallet_summury
string-array.item: 8 main chains including BTC, ETH, etc
ETH, AVAX, BSC and all EVM Chains

resources.string: How to create a Read only account in XUMM：
How to create a watch-only account in XRP Toolkit：
How to create a %s watch-only wallet in Polkadot{.js}：

1. Open Keystone Mobile and add new wallet
2. Choose "Hardware Wallet" and touch "Bind" button
3. Touch "Display QR Code" below then scan the QR Code with Keystone App

Download Keystone App：
https://keyst.one/app

1. Open Polkadot{.js} and choose %s
2. Click "Accounts" and choose "Accounts"
3. Click "Add via Qr"
4. Scan the QR Code that displays on Keystone

1. Open XUMM and create a new account.
2. Choose "Import existing account"
3. Choose "Read only" and touch "Next"
4. Scan the QR Code of address that displays on Keystone
The first address (m/44\'/144\’/0\’/0/0) is generated by default. If you want to sync other addresses, you can add addresses after entering the wallet and scan the address with XUMM
5. Touch "Next" and enter the Read only account

1. Open XRP Toolkit, click "Connect Wallet"
2. Select "Keystone Device"
3. Click "Scan Keystone" in XRP Toolkit
4. Tap the button below and scan the QR code

① Open MetaMask and click \'Connect Hardware Wallet\'
② Select \'QR-based HW Wallet\'
③ Click \'Scan QR Code\' button
④ Scan the QR Code of wallet
⑤ Select account and unlock
⑥ Enter account

Tutorials connecting other companion app,
please visit: https://keyst.one/web3
Hint：\nOn Polkadot{.js}, you need to create watch-only wallets for DOT and KSM separately.
Scan the QR code using Keystone App
Scan the QR code using XUMM
Scan the QR code using XRP Toolkit
Scan the QR Code using Watch-only Wallet
Scan the QR code using Polkadot{.js}
Scan QR code with XRP Toolkit
The first address is generated by default. If you want to sync other addresses, you can add addresses after entering the wallet.
Please scan QR Code built by %s
The current wallet is using the %s Keystone derivation path. The transaction that you just scanned is a derivation path for %s. Please switch your wallet to %s and try again.
The transaction does not belong to the current wallet, please check the transaction information.

1. Open XRP Toolkit
2. In the menu bar, go to Account and select the Properties menu item
3. Look at the Account Properties page for the Message Key section
4. Click the small QR code icon in the Message Key field
5. Scan the Message Key QR Code that displays on Keystone
6. Click the Update button
7. Sign the transaction
Prepare for claiming your Spark tokens：
Display QR Code of Message Key
Scan the QR Code of XRP Toolkit
This currency is not currently supported
Polkadot{.js} watch-only does not support this currency
This transaction types are not currently supported.
You need to enter the recovery phrase of this wallet when switch watch-only wallet to Polkadot{.js}. For details, please visit: https://keyst.one/dot
Difficulty scanning, you can adjust the size of the QR Code or lower the density of the QR Code

1. Touch "Fill in your 23 words" button below
2. Select the first 23 from the official list of 2048 words and fill in
3. Keystone will calculate the 24th word
4. Back up your Recovery Phrase
The official list of 2048 words and more details, please visit: https://keyst.one/24th
Create your own 24 words Recovery Phrase

You have triggered an advanced function of "Create your Recovery Phrase". Please make sure that you fully understand the dangers of this feature before proceeding to generate a recovery phrase with it. Your funds might get compromised if you fail to do so. Proceed at your own risk!
I fully understand entropy, BIP39, private key generation and other related material to generate my recovery phrase.

string.name: learn_more
string.Data: Keystone supports the decoding of transactions. Please visit https://keyst.one/abi for more details.

string.name: learn_more_doc
string.Data:
Keystone supports the decoding of transactions. Please visit
https://keyst.one/addabi
for more details.

resources.string: * Please check transaction details before signing
Please choose one of the following words as the 24th word
Please make sure you have inserted a microSD card
This operation will erase all files in the MicroSD Card and format the card into FAT32 format. Please back up the important files before formatting.
Please format the microSD card to FAT32 format. Otherwise, files cannot be read nor exported.
Note: proceeding will erase all files on this microSD card. Please ensure all of your files have been safely backed up prior to commencing with the formatting.
You can also go to Menu > Setting > System Setting > Format Card
The fee of this transaction is too high, Confirm whether to sign.

If your recovery phrase was imported from a ledger device (ledger live/legacy), all of your assets might not be identified with the QR code above. Please <font color="#00cdc3"><u>click here</u><font/>to switch to the wallet QR code.
<font color="#00cdc3">Ledger Live<font/> to connect to Ledger
Take the Keystone Ethereum Extension import process as an example, the process of other wallets is similar.
Data can‘t be decoded as utf-8 string.
Please select the derivation path you want to use. The first 3 accounts (addresses) are displayed for each path.
Please use your laptop or mobile phone to open the links below for detailed tutorials of how to use Keystone with specific companion software wallets.
